abstract.para: The topic covers the deployment and post-deployment steps of &productnameshort; in public clouds.

topic.para: The following procedure summarizes the deployment and post-deployment of the &productnameshort; image.

step.para: Deploy the image to the public cloud. The specific procedure differs according to the particular cloud vendor, refer to the particular documentation for details.

The image comes with a default initial configuration that might not suit your needs. For example, you may want to add another user on top of the default user. To change this configuration, proceed as described in .
Register the system as described in .
You may want to create different users from the running system. For a procedure of doing so, refer to .

section.title: Modifying the default configuration
section.para: The default configuration is stored in /usr/lib/ignition/base.d/base.ign that is a part of the read-only file system. Therefore, direct changes to this file are not allowed. To modify this file, perform the following steps:

step.para: Edit the /usr/lib/ignition/base.d/base.ign file to suit your needs. Here you can also add other users of the system, repartition the system and so on.

The file is read by &ignition; during the next boot. &ignition; reconfigures the system according to the instructions in the file. For details about the &ignition; configuration, refer to &ignition; configuration examples.
Exit the &tr-up; shell by entering exit.

section.title: Registration
section.para: After you deploy the image, you need to register the system. In newer images, you can use the registercloudguest command to register the system. For details, refer to the Public Cloud Guide.
